intro: Crepis scabra, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy, rough leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in grassy areas, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils. Crepis scabra is an annual or biennial plant that is relatively easy to grow in gardens with well-drained soil.
